utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Joseph, this is the last time we can do this.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: I'm going back to my husband.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Alfonso?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Angie, baby, what about us?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Oh, my God, that's him. He's home early.

utterance.speaker: ALFONSO
utterance.content: Angela, are you upstairs?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Hide in the closet. Mi bello!

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: All right, what's going on, fellas? The gag reel getting a little thin?

utterance.speaker: CREWMAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Oh, my God. It's Sarah! They killed Sarah!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you aren't cooking breakfast. So, what is all this?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Spring cleaning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! Well, Mother, I am-- I am shocked that you even know how to operate a sponge.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh! I have cleaned before. Well, I-- supervised cleaning before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what has, uh, prompted this sudden burst of domestic devotion?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: The space for my acting school won't be ready for another month, Alexis is all busy with her AP tests, my lunch date canceled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And if I don't do something productive, I'm going to tear my hair out. So, out of my way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pardon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, speaking of hair. Hello, Beckett. Yes. 1777 21st Street. All right, I'll meet you there.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Did you say 1777 21st Street?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, there was a murder there. Why?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I know that address. That's Gemstar Studios. That's where they film Temptation Lane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The soap opera you used to be on.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I-- I hope it's nobody that I know. Maybe I should go with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's a crime scene, Mother, for trained professionals.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard Castle. You are neither trained, nor a professional.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'll text you with updates.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim's name is Sarah Cutler. Looks like she was killed last night and stuffed into a closet on set.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was she a part of the production?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess. The diva actress that everyone hated.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, Castle, she was a writer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A writer?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would anyone want to kill a writer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so many reasons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe Sarah discovered that Greek billionaire Mikos had invented a machine that could cause blizzards that would plunge the entire world into an ice age.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? You're gonna go with a evil weather machine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It already happened. On General Hospital. Look, bear in mind, we're entering into a world of epic drama with larger than life characters, each one teeming with twisted secrets and personal intrigue. It stands to reason that the motive for this murder will be worthy of a soap opera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, even in a world of epic drama, the motives are usually quite ordinary.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, does that look ordinary to you? The victim with an axe in her back on the set of her own show. Odds are, the killer walks amongst us on this very soundstage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what've we got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Her spinal cord was severed with the axe. Upon contact, her lungs filled with blood, causing her to drown. I can put the time of death in the four hour window somewhere between 7 and 11 p.m. last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where did this axe come from?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It's the fire axe from the stage. Crew members think it might be symbolic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Symbolic?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, when Miss Cutler took over writing the show, first thing she did was kill off one of the main characters with an axe. Helped save the show, but some of the fans were unhappy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You damn right, we were unhappy. Ashley Conrad was the matriarch of Temptation Lane for thirty years. And then, all of a sudden, whap!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Right. Based on the CSU sweep, she was killed right here. The killer wiped up the blood spatter and shoved her in the closet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means they knew there was a closet to shove her into, suggesting someone familiar with the layout. An insider, perhaps.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, I just checked with Security. They're on high alert now, but, as you can tell, things aren't exactly buttoned up around here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the cameras?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only one at the main entrance, but no one was manning the entrance to this soundstage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so, it is possible that someone from the outside got in. Have you talked to next of kin?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Husband was on set when the body was discovered. Turns out, he's one of the directors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. So, why don't you guys get statements from the actors that found her. Castle and I'll talk to the husband.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: It's tragic, really. Sarah was a gem. Supremely talented, too.

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: It all begins with the words.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But it's also how you say them.

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: So true. My performance brings Angela Cannon to life. Without Sarah's words, I'd just be an incredibly gorgeous woman named Mandy Bronson.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: She really understood Joseph Fox. My character. He's very complicated.

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Complicated? A five year old could write him.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Yeah, I'd be insulted if you actually knew anything about acting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Miss Bronson, what time did you leave the studio last night?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: We wrapped at six and then went straight home. I, um...

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Drew a bath, poured a glass of wine, put on a little John Legend. Then I slipped out of my silk robe and let the bubbles soak every inch of my body.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow. Dude. Dude.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'm just--

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Hastings, how about you?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Ditto.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You also drew a bubble bath and listened to some John Legend?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: No, I left right after we wrapped.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And when did you last see Sarah?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: She came down to the set right before we shot a love scene.

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Ha! More like a torture scene with me getting smothered by his bulk. Why don't you get your ass to the gym?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: I'll go to the gym if you pop a tic-tac the next time we have to kiss.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can we get back to Sarah for just one more moment? Did she have any enemies in the production?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: No, no! Sarah was wonderful. Everybody loved her.

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Yeah, she treated everyone with respect. I can't imagine who would do this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Powers, when was the last time you spoke with your wife?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: I, um, spoke with Sarah last night. Right-- right here. Right where we're standing right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did the two of you talk about?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: End of the day, just touching base.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: Maybe a little after six.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Didn't you find it strange that Sarah didn't come home last night?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: I'm used to it. Sarah's the head writer. Long hours writing scripts kind of comes with the territory.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She have any trouble with cast or crew?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: Well, everybody here has an agenda, and Sarah had to make a lot of tough decisions, but nobody here would actually hurt her. We're like a family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about anyone outside the show?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: No, not that I-- Wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: FoxCanLover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: FoxCanLover?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: About a week ago, Sarah had this-- this crazy, obsessed fan kicked off the set. Sh--she writes an unofficial blog about the show. She's a shipper who goes by the screen name FoxCanLover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A shipper?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. It's a person who invests in the relationships of a show. In this case, it would be Joseph Fox and Angela Cannon. Hence, FoxCan.

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: Exactly. But once she gets here, she loses it, goes crazy, threatens Sarah. Security has to escort her off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know the lady's name?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: No, I-- I don't, but Sarah's assistant would. Reese Harmon.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Is it true?

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: I'm so-- I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: My baby's gone!

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: VINCE POWERS
utterance.content: This is, um, this is Sarah's mom, Gloria Chambers. Detective Beckett is investigating Sarah's murder.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: It's so unfair. I just got her back and now she's gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Chambers, were the two of you estranged?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: We had been for years. I gave her up for adoption when I was young. What kind of monster would do this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don't know just yet, but we are gonna do everything we can to bring them to justice.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: You'd better. Or I will sue the entire city for every nickel it's worth!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I understand being upset, but threatening to sue?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, everybody processes their grief differently.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Unless she's a gold digging opportunist who's insinuated herself back into her daughter's life because she's in need of a heart transplant and Sarah is the only compatible donor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm, sure, maybe on Temptation Lane. Not in the real world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, speaking of which, FoxCan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Joseph Fox and Angela Cannon, how did you know their names?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, one of the uniforms briefed me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. And shippers. Relationship fans?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I do read, you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, are you Reese Harmon?

utterance.speaker: REESE HARMON
utterance.content: FoxCanLover's real name is Carrie Edwards. She won the set visit from a literacy charity that Sarah supported. She paid a thousand dollars for it. Everything was fine at first, but when she saw Sarah, she got in her face and started yelling, "You ruined everything!"

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she ever send Sarah any threatening letters? Anything that you might have on file?

utterance.speaker: REESE HARMON
utterance.content: No. But she did write some pretty awful things on her blog. I'll show you that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Sarah was working late, why weren't you here? You-- you are her assistant.

utterance.speaker: REESE HARMON
utterance.content: I usually stay, but Sarah wouldn't let me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: REESE HARMON
utterance.content: One of her passions was helping young writers. She got me a position at the network fellowship program. We had a mixer last night. She was supposed to come, but she never showed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: REESE HARMON
utterance.content: Around 6:30. Brought her her coffee and scone. Here it is. Last week, the day of the set visit, look at what she wrote.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: "Made it onto the set, but didn't complete the mission."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at the most recent post. "Last time, I failed. This time I will succeed. She's been stabbing us loyal fans in the back. Now it's our turn to take her down..."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: "It's time to give her the axe."

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: She's dead? Sarah Cutler's dead? This is the best news ever. Can I send a quick Tweet? Not cool? I'll wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Must've been difficult not to blog about it last night.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: Yeah, how would I know. Wait. You guys think I had something to do this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I mean, your blog clearly spells out your determination to take out Sarah.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: But everybody talks tough on the internet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You wrote, "It's time to give her the axe," the day she was killed with an axe.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: Okay. Now, I can explain this!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We already figured it out. You bought the set visit to get closer to Sarah. The visit was cut short. You came back last night, when no one was around, and then you remembered there's an axe on the soundstage.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: No, no, no! I bought the set visit because she was being swayed by the CanFonsos!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: The CanFonsos. The opposition. They believe that Angela Cannon should be together with Alfonso Dominguez. I was trying to convince her that Angela belongs with Joseph!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With an axe.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: Yes! Wait. No. I was organizing a protest, okay? We were gonna send a whole bunch of axes to the head of the network, demanding that Sarah be fired. I've got everybody on my website doing it. We want them to know that we think Sarah's ruining the show!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between seven and eleven?

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: I was chatting with the other FoxCans.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wild guess. Alone?

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: No. No, and I can prove it. Mary and Dennis were home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And those are your roommates?

utterance.speaker: CARRIE EDWARDS
utterance.content: No, my parents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just don't see that girl swinging an axe, let alone leaving her house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's the matter? Homicidal fan not soapy enough for you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, when you say soapy, I conjure up images--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, focus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On our suspect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, you saw how obsessive she was. She invests in these fictional relationships. She cares if Angela's gonna get back together with Alfonso, if Marguerite's gonna survive her cancer scare--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, my god.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You watch Temptation Lane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one said anything--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: --about Marguerite's cancer scare. You know a lot about shippers. You know about FoxCans. You are a fan. A big, fat, Temptation Lane fan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, maybe I watched, it, like, once or twice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's just so delightfully not you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So says the guy who rattles off plot points from General Hospital.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that is completely different! That is for research.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What was for research?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mary and Dennis confirm that blogger chick was in her room all night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the cast and crew?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So far, all their alibis checked out. But I was looking over Sarah's schedule. Last week, there were a couple of appointments that just say "M". And there was another one the day before the murder, and then one scheduled for tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So...

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, her assistant didn't schedule these, which means it was personal. And her husband didn't know about them, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With Sarah's work load, it must've been important for her to make time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Exactly. And her husband and assistant both say, when she came back from this appointment, she was upset.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let's see what we can dig up from that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. What'd you find at the apartment?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Her husband's stuff. His clothes are gone, and only her stuff is in the bathroom. So, I talked to the doorman, and he said that Vince hasn't lived there in almost two months. They've been separated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Funny he didn't mention that earlier. Looks like someone's hiding something on Temptation Lane.

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: Look, I knew if I told you that my marriage was in trouble that I would be suspect number one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe. But, now that we know that you lied, it makes you look even worse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did you separate?

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: Everything changed after Sarah got the big promotion. If I wanted to spend time with my own wife, I had to schedule an appointment. It wasn't working. So, I moved out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, there's another version of this story where your wife kicked you out, and then she demanded a divorce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. Only, this way, you don't have to worry about splitting your assets.

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: I didn't kill my wife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then where were you the night that she was killed?

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: I was at the hotel. I went there immediately after we wrapped here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And can anyone vouch for that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, Vince. Tell us you were alone. It'll make arresting you that much easier.

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: I, um... I wasn't alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm gonna need a name.

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: Mandy Bronson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mandy Bronson? As in Angela Cannon? As in star of Temptation Lane?

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: Yes, that Mandy Bronson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just checking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she stay the night?

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: No. We ordered room service and, um, about seven o'clock, she got an e-mail from Sarah and she went running off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, the night that your wife was killed, she e-mailed your mistress? And you didn't think that that was important to mention?

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: It wasn't a big deal. I asked Mandy about it. Well, she got some new script pages that Sarah wanted her to look over. So, she went home to memorize them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you alone the rest of the night?

utterance.speaker: VINCENT POWERS
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, I cracked the mini-bar, I ordered Pay Per View. You can check.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It can't be the husband.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? He's got motive?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but marriage on the rocks, killing for money? That's just so...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ordinary.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to focus on Mandy Bronson. Home wrecking diva engaged in a tour d'affair with the victim's husband. She fled their illicit love nest after a mysterious e-mail from Sarah on the eve of her murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but we don't even know if there was an e-mail. I mean, Vincent could've been lying. But, you are right, Mandy Bronson does have some explaining to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Esplanie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie and Esposito. Like FoxCan. We can call them Esplanie. Which is perfect, because they're always Esplaning things. Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha. What a surprise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. What an unexpected surprise. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Grieving!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn't even know the victim.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, a loss for a show like this is a loss for anyone who was ever part of its history. And...I think I can be of help here. I think I could be your inside source and get the scoop on what's really going on here. Oh-ho-ho, and what better place to start than Lance Hastings?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know him?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He was my love interest 30 years ago. On screen. And off.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes. Oh, darling, I know.

utterance.content: Agreed. So hot, in fact, that it led to a torrid affair with Sarah's director husband. Sarah found out about it, decided to kill off Mandy's character. Doesn't get any soapier than that.

utterance.content: As in .

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dude.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO

utterance.content: Miss Bronson, I'm curious how you felt when you found out that Sarah was gonna kill off your character.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then why did she write this scene where Angela Cannon has an unfortunate encounter with a bull?

utterance.content: Sarah probably writes a death scene for every character on the show. To keep the actors in line.

utterance.content: She wrote those particular pages the night that she was murdered. While you were with her husband. He told us that you left right after you got an e-mail from Sarah. But you didn't go home, did you? You went to go and confront her.

utterance.content: Sarah wanted to save her marriage. She thought the way she could do that was to get me out of the picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you wanted to urge her to reconsider and, when she didn't, you killed her.

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: I admit, I went to see the *****. I told her Angela Cannon is the heart and soul of the show. But when I saw she wouldn't back down, I left. I didn't need to kill her.

utterance.content: And why is that?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: Because I still had a hand to play. Everybody thinks Sarah calls the shots at Temptation Lane, but the second in command, Peter Connelly? He's the one the network really trusts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this other hand that you had to play?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: I did what any industrious actress would do. I went to his apartment straight from the studio and used my powers of persuasion to get him on my side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did you leave?

utterance.speaker: MANDY BRONSON
utterance.content: The sun was up, and my character's still alive.

utterance.content: Yeah, she showed up at my apartment last night. She was wearing a fur coat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: PETER CONNELLY
utterance.content: Just a fur coat. And I nearly had a heart attack when she let it slip open. Years of fantasizing and there she was, standing right in front of me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did she want?

utterance.speaker: PETER CONNELLY
utterance.content: She was all fired up about Sarah wanting to write her off the show. So, then I had to listen to Mandy summarize every soap digest article praising her performance. Just to make her stop, I agreed that I would talk to Sarah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only now you don't have to.

utterance.speaker: PETER CONNELLY
utterance.content: Reese! Grab your laptop and join the group. We're all hands on deck.

utterance.content: You mean it?

utterance.content: I'm not gonna ask you twice.

utterance.content: Sounds like you're pretty desperate.

utterance.speaker: PETER CONNELLY
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, you publish, what? One book a year?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Give or take.

utterance.speaker: PETER CONNELLY
utterance.content: In that same time period, we produce 250 episodes. I'm down a writer. Reese wrote some script about horses that Sarah actually liked. So, yeah, I'm gonna take the extra help where I can get it. Unless, of course, you'd like to jump in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what's interesting? With Sarah out of the way, Mandy gets to stay on the show and you get promoted.

utterance.speaker: PETER CONNELLY
utterance.content: Hey, I'm a professional. Mandy's staying because Angela Cannon is the heart and soul of this show.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, where have I heard that before? Uh, we'll keep in touch. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, the hotel confirmed that the time sensors in Vince's mini-bar were activated until 11:30 p.m.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, I guess our deadly love triangle wasn't so deadly after all.

utterance.content: Not on his side, anyway. But the hot news is, Ryan got a hit on those mystery appointments Sarah was going to. He found credit card charges that matched up time and date to the meetings.

utterance.content: To a coffee shop on 7th. According to her calendar, her next meeting is in about an hour.

utterance.content: Castle, you up for a coffee break?

utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.content: Do you recognize this woman?

utterance.content: She can't be dead! She can't be dead! She can't.

utterance.content: I'm so sorry, Miss Goldberg.

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: It's not fair. It is so not fair. What am I supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did the two of you know each other very well?

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Actually, I didn't know her at all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why would you be so upset?

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Well, because she promised she would read my screenplay and, if she liked it, she would help me find an agent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who would she meet when she came here?

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: What's it matter? She's dead. I lost my chance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'll tell you what, I'll make you a deal. If you tell us what happened after that, I'll read your script and if I like it, I'll give it to my agent.

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: She met with a guy and they sat at a table in a corner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember what he looked like?

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Um. Like him.

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Exactly like him.

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: A double espresso...

utterance.speaker: LAUREN GOLDBERG
utterance.content: What about my script?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'll come back and get it when we're done.

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: Do I know you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm a friend of Sarah Cutler.

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: Yeah? You bring my money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What money?

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: Look, I did what she asked, and now I want what I'm owed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And, uh, what is it that she asked you to do?

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: None of your damn business. Who the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. Sarah's dead, so it is my business. Now, who the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: Johnny Dimes, I'm a P.I. Sarah Cutler was a client. What do you mean she's dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She's dead. Only really has the one meaning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she hire you to follow her husband?

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: Husband? No. She hired me to investigate Gloria Chambers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The mom. I knew it. Was she involved in organ harvesting?

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY DIMES
utterance.content: That didn't really come up. But I can tell you this, Gloria Chambers isn't her real birth mom. She's a fake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. The mom isn't really the mom? Does it get any soapier than that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh! Oh, it's that the P.I.'s file on Sarah's faux mother?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Apparently, Gloria showed up three years ago claiming to be Sarah's birth mom and Sarah got suspicious, so she hired a P.I. in order to look into Gloria's history.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What nefarious scheme has Gloria set into motion? Perhaps she planned on replacing Sarah with a clone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She wanted Sarah's money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Money!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry to burst your bubble, Castle, but Gloria's got a history of insurance scams and husbands with empty bank accounts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You bringing her in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we're trying. We put out an APB. Her apartment's empty, and the doorman saw her leave with a suitcase this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, maybe Dimes tells Sarah about Gloria. Sarah confronts her, and then Gloria kills Sarah in order to avoid exposure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And, after playing the role of grieving mother on set, Gloria knew enough to get the hell out of Dodge.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Look who got caught trying to buy a ticket to the Bahamas at JFK.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gloria.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Everything in New York reminded me of Sarah. I needed to distance myself from the agonizing truth that she's dead. And now, if denial is a crime, I plead guilty.

utterance.content: Good to know. Now, how do you plead on murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gloria Chambers, also known as Charlene Sullers, you have been a very busy woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yours is a real rags to riches story. Only trouble is, the riches never seem to be yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fraud in Florida, embezzlement in North Carolina.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I served my time for those prime misunderstandings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then you latched onto your next meal ticket, Constantine Pirelli. After him, it was Ernesto Cruz.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hear they're very anxious for you to come back. With their money.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I was married to those men. It was our money. I can tell you, I earned every penny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But, as usual, you blew it all, and so, you looked for your next ticket, which you found in Sarah Cutler.

utterance.content: You heard an interview where she mentioned being adopted, did a little research, and then showed up as the long lost mother.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Sarah might've been under the impression that she was my daughter, but I didn't kill her. And, in my own way, I was-- I was fond of Sarah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fond enough that you were able to masquerade as her mother. You had motive to kill her. That's why you tried to flee the country.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: What motive?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her will shows that she planned to leave you $300,000.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Oh, she's a generous girl, my Sarah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She's not your Sarah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that's not your money. You knew she wrote you into her will. In fact, you probably planned it all along. So, when she confronted you, you knew that you had a narrow window within which to kill her before she wrote you out.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Here's your problem. I am not your killer. If I were you, I'd look into the other man in her life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What other man?

utterance.content: The one that gave her the two karat Arthur Klein earrings just the other day.

utterance.content: Does this other man have a name?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Sarah didn't tell me that, but whoever he was, they must've just split up, because he was trying to win her over.

utterance.content: Really? You're going to point us to a mysterious stranger?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: It's the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Coming from a professional liar.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I was nowhere near this godforsaken soap set when she died. I-- I was doing something useful with my time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Reading to the blind?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Mm, close. I was donating. To the ponies.

utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.content: And our time of death is estimated at 11 on the outside, and we don't have anything to tie her to the studio.

utterance.content: I thought fake mom was a lock.

utterance.content: Fancy.

utterance.content: Yeah, over ten grand worth of fancy.

utterance.content: Those are worth over ten grand? Please.

utterance.content: Lanie loves diamonds.

utterance.content: "Diamonds are forever. Like my devotion to you." Who writes notes this cheesy?

utterance.content: Well, not the husband. I checked on his financials; he didn't buy them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so, maybe Gloria was telling us the truth. Maybe Sarah was having an affair.

utterance.content: Well, that makes perfect sense. Sarah was separated from her husband, Vince. And after long, grueling days at work, she'd go home to a cold empty apartment. Feeling lonely, betrayed, she seeks comfort the arms of this mystery man...

utterance.content: And she decides that she wants her husband back. So, she writes his mistress, Mandy Bronson, off the show in order to save their marriage...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And her next step would be to get rid of the other man...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, maybe the other man didn't go off quietly into the night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you two practice this when we're not around?

utterance.content: These earrings are exclusive to Arthur Klein's boutique in Chelsea. Let's find out who bought them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.content: Okay. So, Gloria is in the clear. Uniforms showed her the photo at the OTB and a bartender there remembers seeing her at 11:15.

utterance.content: You know, I can see why she fell for Gloria's con. Sarah was motherless, childless, she was taking young writers under her wing. She's looking for family.

utterance.content: Wow, Castle, that's a refreshingly down to earth theory.

utterance.content: Just trying to keep you on your toes.

utterance.content: Hey. So, we ran down purchases at Klein's boutique, and guess who popped?

utterance.content: Cab company drove him back to the studio around eight.

utterance.content: Okay. So, that falls right within the window of our time of death. Go pick him up.

utterance.content: Yeah, we already sent a unit for him. He's not home, he's not answering his phone.

utterance.content: My mother was speaking to him earlier on set. Hi, sweetie. Is Gram there? I need to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.content: I know where the killer is. He's with my mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, it's okay. I'm sure your mom's not in any danger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you're probably right.

utterance.content: I'm sorry, my dear, but after everything I've told you, I can't let you leave this room alive.

utterance.content: Lance, think about what you're doing.

utterance.content: I'm thinking about it...

utterance.content: Think about us!

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: ...I can't--!

utterance.content: Drop the knife!

utterance.content: Drop the weapon!

utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, wait, wait-- Wait a minute. Wait a minute.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh! Richard! What are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, nothing. Just saving your life, that's all. She said drop the knife!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: The only thing that knife could kill is butter.

utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.content: It's a prop.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: We were just working out a scene.

utterance.content: The knife may be fake, but the axe he put into Sarah's back was real.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You lied to Detectives Ryan and Esposito regarding your whereabouts the night of the murder.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: You want the truth?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That would be a great place to start.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: "You can't handle the truth!"

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I am not interested in your Jack Nicholson impressions. We know that you went back to the studio the night of the murder. And what I'm asking is, why?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: It was a friendly conversation between colleagues.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A friendly conversation in which she told you she was going to go back to her husband.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: What the hell are you talking about? Why would she do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because she was breaking up with you.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Is that what you think is going on here? You think that-- Sarah and I were lovers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you or did you not buy an expensive pair of diamond earrings for her.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Yes, but not to woo her. It was to encourage Sarah to let me out of my contract for a movie role.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A movie role?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: Yes. The Coen brothers have asked me to play Matt Damon's halfwit dad in their new movie. It's a role of a lifetime. It has nominations written all over it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That still doesn't explain why you went back to the studio that night.

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: I went to thank Sarah in person, because my agent had called me that evening to tell me that she had agreed to let me out. The reason I didn't mention any of this is, I didn't want to risk missing work on the movie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn't you just call her?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: I wanted her to know how much I appreciated it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, you went back to thank her, and that's it?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: No. Not exactly. Um, when I got there, she was reading a script and she seemed upset. I asked her why, and she said somebody'd betrayed her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: At first I thought it was me for taking the movie role, but then she said that someone wasn't who she thought they were.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she didn't let on as to who this person was?

utterance.speaker: LANCE HASTINGS
utterance.content: No. I didn't want to give her the opportunity to change her mind about the movie. So, I exited stage left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, found the deal memo Sarah signed in order to get Lance out for his movie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wasn't lying. My mother's never going to let me forget this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Castle. She'll probably think it was sweet that you were concerned about her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is Martha Rogers we are talking about. I intruded on her "moment." No, I will pay dearly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When Lance came here, Sarah told him that someone wasn't who she thought they were. Who do you think that was?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about the woman who makes my mother look like a saint?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but Sarah already cut Gloria out of her life. Maybe... maybe it was her cheating husband.
